be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.importance.external.permutation

Class ChisqOnTwoConfusionTables

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.importance.external.permutation.PermImportance<double[],long[][]>
      • be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.importance.external.permutation.ChisqOnTwoConfusionTables
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExternalImportanceIF<double[]>, ImportanceIF<double[]>

    public class ChisqOnTwoConfusionTables
extends PermImportance<double[],long[][]>
    Given a contingency table, computes a chi^2 test on the sum over all trees of the contingency tables for each variable. See J. Paul and P. Dupont, Inferring statistically significant features from random forests, Neurocomputing, Volume 150, Part B, 20 February 2015, pp. 471-480, ISSN 0925-2312.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.importance.external.permutation.PermImportance

      Initialize an object that aggregates contingency table with a sum followed by a chi^2 test

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChisqOnTwoConfusionTables

        public ChisqOnTwoConfusionTables(Data d,
                         java.util.Random rnd,
                         PermutationIndexWithDimIF<long[][]> permutationIndex,
                         boolean pval)
        Initialize an object that aggregates contingency table with a sum followed by a chi^2 test
        Parameters:
        d - the dataset
        rnd - a random number generator used to create permutations of the OOB
        permutationIndex - an object that computes a statistic for one variable in a particular tree
        pval - should the computed importance be p-values or the chi^2 statistic ?

    • Method Detail

      • getImportances

        public double[] getImportances()
        Returns:
        the importance of all variables

      • addStatOfVar

        protected void addStatOfVar(int v,
                long[][] index,
                int treeId)
        Description copied from class: PermImportance
        Adds the statistic of variable v computed on one tree. This should be called for each variable on each tree.
        Specified by:
        addStatOfVar in class PermImportance<double[],long[][]>
        Parameters:
        v - is the column index of the variable in the full dataset
        index - is the value of the statistic computed on one tree with and without permuting variable v
        treeId - is the id of the current tree
